title: Syntax of CASE Statement
text:
The basic syntax of a CASE statement is:

```
CASE
WHEN condition1 THEN result1
WHEN condition2 THEN result2
ELSE result3
END
```

hintAnswer: By specifying WHEN conditions and THEN results within the CASE statement.
title: Using CASE for Conditional Logic
text: How can you use the CASE statement to categorize data based on a condition? It is similar to the 'if' statement in other programming languages.
choices: By specifying WHEN conditions and THEN results within the CASE statement.
By using the SELECT statement to filter data.
By using the JOIN statement to combine tables.
By using the DELETE statement to remove records.
